ext_description.p:
A Reference_geometric_representation_relationship is a type of . One purpose of a Reference_geometric_representation_relationship is the association of a with its to create a resultant . In the case where the placement is not supplied, both are in the same geometric context.
Another purpose of a is to relate a representation of a design view and a representation of a usage view for design archival purposes. In this case a placement shall not be supplied.
A Reference_geometric_representation_relationship is included to support composition of basic geometric features in support of templates. and other types of location Application Objects support composition of assembly or interconnect shapes. supports composition of shapes in the usage view. The name is generic to support extensibility. Mirroring is possible by use of . The use of mirroring should be carefully considered to avoid confusion in receiving systems. Mirroring of symmetric constructs should be avoided. Mirroring in the case of design and usage views shall be prohibited.
ext_description.example: A Reference_geometric_representation_relationship would be used to transform or reference a circle shape for a detail into an overall template shape. In this way there would be one instance of a circle of a given size in the template model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the resultant_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Reference_geometric_representation_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the attribute inherited from .
the related_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Reference_geometric_representation_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the attribute inherited from .

the related_feature_shape_placement specifies the role of the or of the for the Reference_geometric_representation_relationship. The related_feature_shape_placement is optional and need not be supplied.
Either a related_feature_shape_placement shall exist or the geometric context shall be the same for the related_feature_shape and for the resultant_feature_shape.

ext_description.p: If the related_feature_shape is either a or a Physical_unit_3d_shape, and if an is the shape_characterized_physical_unit of the related_feature_shape, then the related_feature_shape_placement shall not exist.
ext_description.note: This forces the geometric context for the two shape representations to be the same. It is important not to constrain this relationship too much as the types of the representations may not be the same, and the identical geometric context is appropriate.
